qas.question: What is the most common form of oxygen on the planet?
What is the scientific designation of oxygen?
What part the composition of the Earth's atmosphere is comprised of oxygen?
What characteristic of oxygen makes it necessary to life?
For what purpose is oxygen used by animal life?
What is oxygen on Earth, O, referred to as?
What has a bond energy of 121 pm?
What has a bond length of 498 kJ·mol−1?
Why do animals use O2 for biological respiration?

context:
The common allotrope of elemental oxygen on Earth is called <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0>dioxygen<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, O
2. It is the form that is <a2_3>a <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_4>major<a2_4/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> part<a2_3/> of the Earth's atmosphere (see Occurrence). <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>O2<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> has a bond length of 121 pm and a bond energy of 498 kJ·mol−1, which is smaller than the energy of other double bonds or pairs of single bonds in the biosphere and responsible for the exothermic reaction of O2 with any organic molecule. Due to <a3_1><a3_4>its <a3_0><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>energy content<b8_0/><a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, O2 is used by complex forms of life, such as animals, <a4_3>in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_4>cellular respiration<a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> (see Biological role). Other aspects of O
2 are covered in the remainder of this article.
